help.helpDescription: Тебе действительно так важно узнать предназначение этой команды?

embedReply.title: Лист команд | Префикс: {PREFIX}
embedReply.description:
Сайт:
[{WEBSITE}]({WEBSITE})
Документация:
[https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter](https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter)```css
{PREFIX}help (команда)
{PREFIX}counts
{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (произвольное название канала)
{PREFIX}newCategoryNameCounter [type] (произвольное название канала)
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)
{PREFIX}setTopic (#channels) [topic]
{PREFIX}removeTopic (#channel)
{PREFIX}setDigit [нынешнее число] [произвольное число]
{PREFIX}lang [код языка]
{PREFIX}prefix [новый префикс]
{PREFIX}role [allow/deny] [@roles/all]
{PREFIX}seeSettings
{PREFIX}resetSettings
{PREFIX}upgradeServer
{PREFIX}profile
{PREFIX}info
{PREFIX}support
{PREFIX}donate```
 **Инфо:** `()` подразумевает за собой необязательный/произвольный параметр, когда `[]` подразумевает за собой то, что данный параметр необходим

newChannelNameCounter.helpDescription:
Создаёт канал с необходимым счётчиком.
Использование: ```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (custom name)```
Первый аргумент команды должен быть из приведённого листа ниже.

Доступные вариации:
-`members`
-`users`*
-`bots`*
-`onlinemembers`*
-`onlineusers`*
-`onlinebots`*
-`offlinemembers`*
-`offlineusers`*
-`offlinebots`*
-`bannedmembers`
-`channels`
-`roles`
-`memberswithrole`*
-`connectedusers`*
* = Доступно только в премиум версии бота, подробнее: `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

Второй аргумент опционален, он используется для того, чтобы назначить имя создаваемого канала. Когда вы используете второй аргумент, не забудьте вписать `{COUNT}` туда, где вы хотите видеть счётчик. 

Вы также можете создать счётчик в названии категории, аргументы остаются теми же. Нужно просто заменить команду на эту: `{PREFIX}newCategoryNameCounter`

Примеры:
Счётчик для пользователей всего сервера: ```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members```
С заданным именем канала:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members Members: {COUNT}```
Счетчик для определенной роли/ролей:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter memberswithrole @Admin @Mod {COUNT} Admins and mods```
newChannelNameCounter.noPerms: Мне нужно разрешение 'Управление каналами/Manage Channels' чтобы создать канал.
newChannelNameCounter.noPermsBan: Мне нужно разрешение 'Бан участников/Ban members' чтобы создать канал.

topicCounter.helpDescription:
Использование:```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)```
Данная команда отображает счётчик кол-ва участников в заголовке канала в реальном времени.

Примеры:
```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general #other-channel
{PREFIX}topicCounter disable all```
**!**  Если вы никак не упоминаете название какого-либо канала как в первом примере, счётчик будет включен/выключен во всех каналах.
 **!**  Когда вы хотите упомянуть канал, вы должны использовать точное имя этого канала и перед тем, как написать его имя, использовать `#`
topicCounter.errorInvalidParams: Недействительные параметры, для помощи просмотрите `{PREFIX}!help topicCounter`.

setDigit.helpDescription:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument could be anything, like an emoji or a normal number with markdown.
If the first argument is the word "reset", the numbers will be restored to the default ones.

Usage: ```{PREFIX}setDigit reset
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [your custom number]```
Example: ```{PREFIX}setDigit 3 **3**```
With the previous example every 3 will be shown as a bold **3**
setDigit.resetSuccess: Numbers restored to the default ones.

setTopic.helpDescription:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
You can customize the topic with this command, remember to write `{COUNT}` wherever you want to place the counter. You can also set a unique topic for different channels

If the first argument are channel mentions, the topic given will be only used in the mentioned channels, (remember to mention the channels with ``#``).

`{COUNT}` will show how many members your server has, you can use any of these counters instead:
-`{members}`
-`{users}`*
-`{bots}`*
-`{onlinemembers}`*
-`{onlineusers}`*
-`{onlinebots}`*
-`{offlinemembers}`*
-`{offlineusers}`*
-`{offlinebots}`*
-`{bannedmembers}`
-`{channels}`
-`{roles}`
-`{connectedusers}`*
* = Only available in the premium bot, see `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

Examples:

This will set the topic for those channels without a specific topic defined```{PREFIX}setTopic Current members: {COUNT}```
This will display the given topic only in the first mentioned channels```{PREFIX}setTopic #general Current members: {COUNT}
{PREFIX}setTopic #general #other-channel Current members: {COUNT}```
setTopic.success: Topic customized for all channels without a custom one.
setTopic.successUnique: Topic customized for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
setTopic.noTopic: No topic were provided, more info: `{PREFIX}help setTopic`.

removeTopic.helpDescription:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
This command removes channel topics that has been customized, here is a list of examples:

Removes the customized topic for channels without specific topic:```{PREFIX}removeTopic```
Remove specific topics that has been established by mentioning channels```{PREFIX}removeTopic #general #other-channel```
removeTopic.success_unique: Unique topic removed for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
removeTopic.errorMissingParams: Error: Missing parameters, more info: `{PREFIX}help removeTopic`.

prefix.helpDescription:
Changes the bot prefix.

Usage:```{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]```

role.helpDescription:
You can allow or deny roles to use bot administrative commands.
You can use ``all`` keyword to allow or deny all roles.
To see which roles are currently allowed use `{PREFIX}seeSettings``
```{PREFIX}role allow @Mod
{PREFIX}role allow @Mod @OtherRole
{PREFIX}role deny all```
role.errorNoRolesToUpdate: You must mention at least 1 role

seeSettings.helpDescription: Shows all bot settings for this server.

settingsMessage.allowedRolesText: Allowed roles to use administrative commands:
settingsMessage.mainTopicText: Global topic (used for those without a custom one):
settingsMessage.warningNoPermsText: \⚠️ = The bot cannot continue updating this channel due to lack of permissions

resetSettings.helpDescription: Restores the custom settings of this server to the default ones

update.helpDescription: If you think the counters are stuck use this command to update them again.
update.inProgress: Updating the counters, this may take a while.

upgradeServer.helpDescription: This command allows you to invite Member Counter Premium, to use this command you must have a premium account, which you can get by donating any amount: `{PREFIX}donate`.
upgradeServer.success:
Done! The next step is invite the premium bot:
{BOT_LINK}
upgradeServer.noPremiumAccount: You must have a premium account.
upgradeServer.errorCannotUpgrade: You can't upgrade the server because it already has premium.
upgradeServer.noServerUpgradesAvailable: You can't do more server upgrades because you don't have more server upgrades available, you can check how much you have left with `{PREFIX}profile` or get more with `{PREFIX}donate`

lang.helpDescription: Changes the bot language for this server, you must have administrator permissions to run this command.
lang.errorNotFound: I didn't find that language, try one of the following:

commandHandler.noDm: You can't run this command on a DM channel

getCounts.noBanPerms: I need ban permissions to show this
